byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma reported from Kathmandu, and Nida Najar from New Delhi.
byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Fuel crisis in Nepal caused by ongoing protests over Constitution and quarrel with India, requires rationing; officials accuse India, who provides all of Nepal's fuel, of economic blockade, while India claims its trucks are being blocked by anti-Constitution protesters at Nepalese border.
lead_paragraph: Nepali officials said India was refusing to allow fuel trucks to cross the border because it objects to parts of Nepal’s new Constitution, a claim India denies.

headline.main: Nepal Rations Fuel as Political Crisis With India Worsens
headline.print_headline: Nepal Rations Fuel Amid a Worsening Shortage, and a Dispute With India Flares

snippet: Nepali officials said India was refusing to allow fuel trucks to cross the border because it objects to parts of Nepal’s new Constitution, a claim India denies.
